pageContext.claim: “We are competing with other countries that know how to play the game against the U.S. That’s actually why the E.U. was formed.”
pageContext.analysis: That’s a misreading of history, at best. The E.U. got its start shortly after World War II as the European Coal and Steel Community — an early effort to bind together bitter enemies such as Germany and France in a common economic space to promote peace.
